required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of COX2 on Sera Biomarkers From Obese Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 0, Investigator Initiated Study, Evaluating the Impact of COX2 Inhibition on Human Sera Biomarkers From Obese Subjects

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: Obesity promotes worse outcome for post-menopausal breast cancer patients.

primary_outcome.description: Blood levels of Prostaglandin E2, aromatase, pro-inflammatory cytokines, steroids, and lipids will be measured pre and post treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: Correlation for body mass index impact on response to COX2 inhibition.

arm_group.description: Twenty eight enteric coated 81mg Aspirin tablets will be dispensed for daily oral dosing, to be taken with a meal at the same time of day.

Three hundred thirty-six gelatin coated 450 mg capsules containing approximately 180 mg of EPA and 135 mg of DHA will be dispensed. Patients are to take 12 capsules daily with meals, either once daily (12 capsules with one meal) or divided twice daily (e.g., six with breakfast and six with dinner).
Aspirin (81 mg po daily) to be taken simultaneously with Omega-3 Free Fatty Acids (1500mg of docosahexaoic acid (DHA) and 2500mg eicosapentanoic acid (EPA) given daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 18 years of age
- Post-menopausal as confirmed by medical history
- Ability to understand the purposes and risks of the study and has signed a written informed consent form approved by the investigator's IRB/Ethics Committee
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of active cancer (patients with a prior history of malignancy are encouraged to participate, but due to cytokine levels associated with malignancy there must be no evidence of disease)
- Cachexia
- Active systemic illness (infection including viral illnesses such as Hepatitis and HIV)
- Chronic use of aspirin of omega-3 free fatty acid supplementation within the last 60 days (defined as greater than or equal to 7 consecutive days)
- Known hypersensitivity to aspirin and/or omega-3 fatty acids
- Actively receiving a physician-directed regimen of aspirin and/or receiving herapeutic/prophylactic anticoagulation
- Any aspirin or omega-3 free fatty acid supplementation within the last 14 days
- Subjects who are pregnant
- History of medical noncompliance

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

facility.name: Cancer Therapy and Research Center at UTHSCSA

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio
